item.title: SharePoint Get list items and Effective Permissions on a list via REST API from SharePoint Add-in
item.description: Ofer Gal - Mar 3, 2017 I get error: Uncaught (in promise) TypeError: SP.BasePermissions is not a constructor What else should I load? Sp.js needs to be loaded. Add the following to your page. /_layouts/15/sp.runtime.js /_layouts/15/sp.js

item.title: SharePoint Get list items and Effective Permissions on a list via REST API from SharePoint Add-in
item.description: The requirement was to build a SharePoint hosted Add-in to allow logged user to create/edit list item from any site from the site collection. The permissions of the user to be able to create/edit an item against the list needed to be checked. The following script gets list items with effective permissions against the list using jQuery promises from the SharePoint hosted Add-in function getListItemsAndPermissions(webUrl, listTitle) { var appWebUrl = decodeURIComponent(getQueryStringParameter("SPAppWebUrl")); var deferredPermissions = $.
